About.Name: Ezana Girmay
About.AboutText:
Hi, I’m Ezana Girmay — a passionate computer science student currently pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University. I have a strong interest in software development and programming, with a particular focus on C++. I’m dedicated to continually expanding my technical skills and deepening my understanding of computer science.

I thrive on challenging programming projects and enjoy working in collaborative environments where I can both contribute and grow. I value the opportunity to learn from others while sharing my own insights

Born and raised in the greater Seattle area, I’ve developed a deep appreciation for the outdoors. In my free time, I enjoy exploring Washington’s many hiking trails and staying active through sports like tennis and soccer.

Experience.ExperienceText: During my time at SPU I have been introduced to a wide variety of computer science languages. This has allowed me to quickly pick up new languages and have a strong foundation in the most popular ones. I have also become familiar with many concepts like data structures and run time.
AWS: Passed Amazon Web Services Certified Developer Associate Exam. Proficient in using a multitude of AWS services such as DynamoDB, Amazon EC2, EBS, and S3 buckets. Able to build and deploy applications in a cost effective way. While also prioritizing security and safety to ensure data is not compromised.

Project2.Title: Parking Portal (SPU:CSC3150  March 2023 - May 2024)
Project2.Desc: Parking Portal is an application that hopes to provide easy and convenient parking for SPU students. With an app on their phones, students can make an account using their SPU emails and buy parking passes. These passes will allow them to park at any SPU parking lot they want. To better support the user's needs, we allow them to either buy a pass by the hour or buy a pass for the whole day. By allowing students to save their car's license plate and their credit card information they will be able to purchase these passes in a matter of seconds. And on the unfortunate chance they are issued a ticket, our users can pay for it directly on the app. This application has a System Proposal and System Specification completed, which can both be found in Git Hub. The System Proposal gives a complete breakdown of what the application will entail, including any requirements that need to be met in order to build it. The System Specification also gives an overview of the application software layout and includes UI designs for the app.

Project3.Title: CapSource (SPU:CSC4898 SEP. 2024 - May 2025)
Project3.Desc: Developed and deployed a crowed funded caption correction application within a team. Used extensions on browsers and web site to allow users to quickly make suggested changes to video publisher. This allowed the video publisher to produce correct transcripts for their video with our spending hours correcting it themselves.
